Drebar 'langit' tanpa lesen [METROTV]
04 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Oleh Ekhwan Haque Fazlul Haque, Hafiz Ithnin dan Mahaizura Abd Malik
Bekerja di lokasi berisiko tinggi namun tidak memiliki lesen kompetensi yang melayakkan mereka mengendalikan kren menara.
Itu situasi yang berlaku di kebanyakan tapak pembinaan di seluruh negara sejak pertengahan 1990-an lagi.
Namun senario itu dikesan semakin membimbangkan berikutan pertambahan projek pembinaan bangunan komersial dan kediaman bertingkat selari dengan perkembangan ekonomi Malaysia.
Mendedahkan perkara itu, Timbalan Presiden Persatuan Pekerja Mahir Kren Menara Malaysia (Perkema) Raziz Abdul Rahman berkata, kira-kira 500 operator kren menara di Malaysia tidak memiliki lesen kompetensi seperti disyaratkan Jabatan Keselamatan dan Kesihatan Pekerjaan (JKKP) sejak 2013.
Beliau berkata, kegagalan operator kren menara memiliki lesen kompetensi disebabkan keengganan kontraktor membayar gaji mengikut kelayakan pengendali berkemahiran sehingga sanggup menggaji mereka yang tidak berkelayakan.
Menurutnya, keadaan itu mengundang risiko berlakunya kemalangan sehingga menyebabkan kecederaan serius dan maut apabila operator kren menara tidak memiliki ilmu teori dan praktikal tentang pengendalian jentera berkenaan terutama dalam aspek keselamatan.
“Mereka yang tidak mempunyai lesen senang diambil bekerja oleh kontraktor kerana bayaran yang murah sekitar RM80 sehari berbanding operator berlesen yang perlu dibayar RM180 ke atas sehari.
“Kontraktor yang mementingkan keuntungan dan mahu projek siap ikut jadual menyebabkan mereka beralih kepada operator tidak berlesen.
“Soal keselamatan operator dan pekerja di tapak pembinaan dan sekitarnya tidak diambil peduli,” katanya.
Menurutnya, apa yang membimbangkan operator kren menara tidak kompeten menyebabkan soal keselamatan dipandang ringan kerana sebagai pengendali, pelbagai aspek khususnya beban angkatan dan keadaan fizikal kren menjadi keutamaan.


OPERATOR, Mohd Bakri Ashmad Bakar yang bertugas di kren menara miliki segala kelulusan mengikut undang-undang.

Beliau berkata, berdasarkan Perintah Khas Ketua Pemeriksa Berkenaan Pengurusan dan Pengendalian Selamat Kren Menara 2017 JKKP, seseorang operator kren menara perlu memiliki lesen kompetensi yang disahkan pihak berkuasa.
“Lawatan mengejut dilakukan Perkema di tapak pembinaan mengesan ramai pengendali kren menara tidak berlesen dan ada antara kejadian yang menyebabkan kematian disebabkan kurang faham pengendali tentang prosedur operasi standard.
“Jika terjadi kemalangan, operator kren tidak berlesen ini sudah pasti menghilangkan diri manakala kontraktor pula akan lepas tangan dan enggan bertanggungjawab dengan kejadian yang berlaku,” katanya.
Katanya, masalah operator kren menara tidak berlesen ini perlu ditangani khususnya daripada segi pemantauan dan penguatkuasaan kerana membabitkan nyawa banyak pihak yang mungkin tergadai disebabkan kerakusan sesetengah pihak mengaut keuntungan mudah.


OPERATOR kren menara bekerja di lokasi berisiko tinggi.

Drebar 'sky' without license [METROTV]
04 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Ekhwan Haque Fazlul Haque, Hafiz Ithnin and Mahaizura Abd Malik
Work in high risk locations but do not have a competency license that entitles them to control tower cranes.
That has been the case at most construction sites around the country since the mid-1990s.
However, the scenario was found to be more alarming as more commercial and residential building projects increased in tandem with the growth of the Malaysian economy.
Revealing the matter, Malaysian Crane Tower Workers' Union (Perkema) deputy president Raziz Abdul Rahman said about 500 tower crane operators in Malaysia did not have a competency license as required by the Department of Occupational Safety and Health (JKKP) since 2013.
He said the failure of the tower crane operators to have a competency license due to the refusal of contractors to pay salaries according to the skills of skilled operators could afford to hire unqualified workers.
According to him, the situation poses a risk of accidents resulting in serious and fatal injuries if the tower crane operator lacks the theoretical and practical knowledge of the operation of the machinery, especially in terms of safety.
“Those who do not have a license can easily be hired by contractors for a low cost of about RM80 a day compared to licensed operators who have to pay RM180 a day.
“Contractors who are profitable and want the project ready to go on schedule are turning to unlicensed operators.
"The safety of operators and workers at construction sites and the surrounding area is not taken care of," he said.
According to him, the concerns of incompetent tower crane operators led to concerns about safety as operators, various aspects of the force and the physical condition of the crane were a priority.


OPERATOR Mohd Bakri Ashmad Bakar who works on the tower crane has all the necessary legal approvals.

He said that under the Special Order of the Inspector General on the Management and Control of the Tower Crane 2017 JKKP, a tower crane operator would need to have a competency license certified by the authorities.
“Perkema's surprise visit to the construction site detected many unlicensed tower crane operators and some of the incidents that resulted in death due to the operator's lack of understanding of standard operating procedures.
"In the event of an accident, the unlicensed crane operator would have disappeared while the contractor would have withdrawn and refused to take responsibility for the incident," he said.
He said the problem of unlicensed tower crane operators should be addressed especially in terms of monitoring and enforcement as it involved the lives of many who might have been jeopardized by the greediness of some parties for easy profit.
